definition: to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess
to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition
lit. lovely scene of blossoming plants swaying in the breeze (idiom)/fig. gorgeously dressed (woman)

sentences.english: Hang all your leafy banners out!
sentences.chinese: 升起你全部木葉如同旌旗招展。

sentences.english: She dresses up fit to kill even to go out shopping.
sentences.chinese: 她甚至出外購物，也打扮得花枝招展。
她總是打扮得花枝招展。

sentences.english: She doesn't love dressing up, this makes her in beautiful, very thin.
sentences.chinese: 她不愛打扮，這又使她在花枝招展中，格外單薄。

sentences.english: The eastern edge of Willow River seem to elongation, and fluttered in the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 東面緣河兩岸的楊柳似乎也伸長了，迎風招展。

sentences.english: The red flag flaunt in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 紅旗迎風招展如何表達？

sentences.english: Autumn in October, the national flag fluttering, national jubilation.
sentences.chinese: 金秋十月，國旗招展，舉國同慶。

sentences.english: She likes get gussied up and goes to a dancing patty.
sentences.chinese: 她喜歡打扮得花枝招展的去參加舞會。

sentences.english: Beneath the feet of dancing flowers.
sentences.chinese: 躺在迎風招展的花朵腳下。

sentences.english: I am wearing simple dress everyday, stand in be gorgeously dressed among them.
sentences.chinese: 我每天穿着樸素的衣服，站在花枝招展的她們中間。

sentences.english: She dolled herself up as though she was a girl of eighteen.
sentences.chinese: 她打扮得花枝招展，好像是個十八歲的姑娘似的。

sentences.english: It does not have to be pretty to be beautiful.
sentences.chinese: 美並不一定是要花枝招展。

sentences.english: She is well dressed up but nowhere to go .
sentences.chinese: 她打扮得花枝招展，卻無處可去。

sentences.english: When the fog is obsolete, not see flowers fluttering, only pieces of flying catkins, layer upon layer having.
sentences.chinese: 待到霧過時，不見花招展，唯有片片飛絮，層層落英。

definition: to fly up/to dance in the air (of snowflakes, flower petals etc)
to sway gently (as in the wind)/(of a flame) to flicker
to flutter/to dance in the breeze
(of a breeze) to make (hair, leaves, clothing etc) sway gently/to ruffle
to drift/to wave/to float on the waves/to flutter in the wind
lit. people shouting and horses neighing (idiom)/fig. tumultuous/hubbub
